Sir Tom Jones and Priscilla Presley recently hit headlines when it was revealed they were dating, decades after first becoming friends thanks to their late spouses. 
And Vic and Babs Howlett were on This Morning today, talking about their similar story. 
The couple - who are both in their 80s - have known each other for 40 years, having met through their previous partners who worked in a school together. 
Vic’s wife Jo died 2006, and then Babs’ husband Bob died soon after. Read More Vic and Babs Howlett married after their partners died (Photo: ITV) They'd known each other for 40 years (Photo: ITV) 
The couple would originally just go round to each other’s house for a coffee and a chat, but then Vic “pushed the button first” when he invited Babs to go on a Caribbean cruise with him, having been “lonely” when he went alone. 
Vic then realised his “feelings were getting stronger”, and he proposed, but Babs said no originally. 
He then asked again when his greyhound Molly was put down, and she said yes. 
Babs explained: “I had this feeling if I said no again, I’d lose his friendship as well. Read More Vic proposed to Babs twice (Photo: ITV) Babs accepted his proposal because she didn't want to lose his friendship (Photo: ITV) 
“He wanted to cement the friendship. He didn’t know what to call me, his girlfriend, partner, he wanted something more permanent. 
“We have a super time together, we’re always laughing, we go on holidays, we’re out and about all the time.” 
Vic and Babs then confirmed they do speak about Bob and Jo occasionally, and think they’ll both be happy they’ve found love with each other. 
Vic said: “In the few weeks before she passed, Jo said, ‘I don’t mind if you find someone else’, and I said, ‘I haven’t given up on you yet!’”
